dummy/calculator.py.purpose: This file implements a basic command-line calculator providing standard arithmetic operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) through a user interactive loop.

key_entities.name: add
key_entities.usage_behavior: Takes two numerical inputs (x, y) and returns their sum. Called by `main` based on user choice.
key_entities.assumptions_context: Inputs are expected to be numerical.

key_entities.name: subtract
key_entities.usage_behavior: Takes two numerical inputs (x, y) and returns their difference. Called by `main` based on user choice.
key_entities.assumptions_context: Inputs are expected to be numerical.

key_entities.name: multiply
key_entities.usage_behavior: Takes two numerical inputs (x, y) and returns their product. Called by `main` based on user choice.
key_entities.assumptions_context: Inputs are expected to be numerical.

key_entities.name: divide
key_entities.description: Performs division of two numbers, including handling division by zero.
key_entities.usage_behavior: Takes two numerical inputs (x, y). If y is 0, it returns an error string; otherwise, it returns the quotient. Called by `main` based on user choice.
key_entities.assumptions_context: Inputs are expected to be numerical.

key_entities.name: main
key_entities.description: Orchestrates the calculator's user interface, input handling, and operation execution.
key_entities.usage_behavior: Initiates a loop that prompts the user for an operation choice and two numbers. It calls the respective arithmetic functions, displays results, and handles invalid inputs (non-numeric, division by zero) or exit commands ('q').
key_entities.assumptions_context: Assumes standard console input/output for interaction. Users are expected to input numbers or specific command characters.

side_effects: Prints welcome messages, operation choices, input prompts, results, and error messages to standard output (console).

dummy/funny.sh.purpose: This bash script simulates a sequence of 'cyber-infiltration' steps, printing messages to the console with timed delays, culminating in a humorous critical error and operation abort.

key_entities.name: Initiation Protocol
key_entities.description: Prints an initiation message to the console.
key_entities.usage_behavior: Executes sequentially at the start of the script, outputting 'Initiating cyber-infiltration protocol...' to stdout.

key_entities.name: Mainframe Bypass Simulation
key_entities.description: Prints a message simulating bypassing a mainframe.
key_entities.usage_behavior: Executes after initiation, outputting 'Bypassing the central mainframe...' to stdout.

key_entities.name: Firewall Decryption Simulation
key_entities.description: Prints a message simulating firewall decryption.
key_entities.usage_behavior: Executes after mainframe bypass, outputting 'Decrypting firewall...' to stdout.

key_entities.name: Accessing User Files Simulation
key_entities.description: Prints a message indicating access to user files.
key_entities.usage_behavior: Executes after firewall decryption, outputting 'Accessing top-secret user files...' to stdout.

key_entities.name: Placeholder Pause
key_entities.description: Prints an ellipses as a visual placeholder.
key_entities.usage_behavior: Executes after attempting to access user files, outputting '...' to stdout.

key_entities.name: Critical Error Message
key_entities.description: Prints a humorous critical error message related to user browser history.
key_entities.usage_behavior: Executes after the placeholder pause, outputting 'CRITICAL ERROR: User's browser history is too embarrassing to process.' to stdout.

key_entities.name: Aborting Operation
key_entities.description: Prints a final message indicating the operation is aborted.
key_entities.usage_behavior: Executes at the end of the script, outputting 'Aborting operation to protect system integrity. Goodbye.' to stdout.
